ingredients.name: Vitamin C
ingredients.description: Vitamin C is a potent antioxidant that protects the skin and promotes collagen production.
ingredients.function: Accelerate skin renewal, boost collagen production, and reduce fine lines and wrinkles. Retinoids are derivatives of Vitamin A and are considered one of the most effective anti-aging ingredients.
ingredients.usage: Start with lower concentrations to assess skin tolerance and gradually increase. Use at night and apply sunscreen during the day as retinoids can increase sun sensitivity.
ingredients.note: Retinoids can be strong, so it’s best to start with a lower concentration to minimize irritation and gradually build tolerance.

ingredients.name: Glycerin
ingredients.description: Glycerin is a hydrating hero that is generally safe for eczema-prone skin, helping to lock in moisture.
ingredients.function: Glycerin is a humectant that draws water into the skin, improving hydration levels and supporting the skin barrier. It is gentle and effective for most skin types, including dry and sensitive skin.
ingredients.usage: Look for products with glycerin as a primary ingredient, especially in moisturizers or serums. Use it morning and evening after cleansing to keep your skin plump and moisturized.
ingredients.note: Glycerin is well-tolerated for eczema, but ensure the product containing it doesn’t include other irritants like fragrance or alcohol, which could offset its benefits.

ingredients.name: Butylene Glycol
ingredients.description: A versatile humectant and texture enhancer, Butylene Glycol helps hydrate and improve the feel of skincare products. It’s generally safe for most skin types.
ingredients.function: This ingredient is used to boost product absorption, hydrate the skin, and improve the texture of formulations. It helps skincare products glide smoothly onto the skin.
ingredients.usage: Use products containing Butylene Glycol as part of your daily routine to maintain hydration, especially in lightweight moisturizers or serums.
ingredients.note: Butylene Glycol is typically non-irritating, but in rare cases, it can cause sensitivity or redness in people with eczema. Monitor your skin for any reactions.

ingredients.name: Hyaluronic Acid
ingredients.description: Hyaluronic Acid (HA) is a hydration powerhouse, perfect for maintaining skin moisture and plumpness, even for eczema-prone skin.
ingredients.function: Hyaluronic Acid is a naturally occurring molecule in the skin that retains up to 1,000 times its weight in water, making it a key ingredient for deep hydration and improving skin elasticity. It helps smooth fine lines and maintain a healthy skin barrier.
ingredients.usage: Apply HA-based serums or moisturizers to damp skin to maximize hydration. It works well with other skincare products and can be used both morning and evening as part of your routine.
ingredients.note: Hyaluronic Acid is safe and non-irritating for most skin types, including sensitive or eczema-prone skin. However, in extremely dry conditions, it may draw moisture from deeper skin layers, so follow with an occlusive moisturizer to lock in hydration.
